nodes.bodyText:
Can this be simple as:
on: [push, pull_request]
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,25 @@
+name: Required Tests
+
+on:
+  push:
+    branches:
+    - master
+  pull_request:
+    branches:
+    - master

nodes.bodyText:
Nope. If you do that, pull_requests, when opened, will have each job run twice. That's not... desirable so this lets you have status both on pull_request opening against master, and also when it gets pushed to master (on merge).
See: https://github.community/t5/GitHub-Actions/How-to-trigger-an-action-on-push-or-pull-request-but-not-both/td-p/35805
And: https://help.github.com/en/actions/automating-your-workflow-with-github-actions/events-that-trigger-workflows
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,25 @@
+name: Required Tests
+
+on:
+  push:
+    branches:
+    - master
+  pull_request:
+    branches:
+    - master

nodes.bodyText: The other issue is that we want to only run this CI for master. Unlike Travis (where each branch has its own .travis.yml, workflows  only get picked up from the default (read: master) branch: https://github.community/t5/GitHub-Actions/Workflow-files-only-picked-up-from-master/td-p/30348
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,25 @@
+name: Required Tests
+
+on:
+  push:
+    branches:
+    - master
+  pull_request:
+    branches:
+    - master

nodes.bodyText:
ACK.
Also, this documentation is confusing. It says ... push or pull request. From this PR's PoV, your second comment negates this issue :)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,25 @@
+name: Required Tests
+
+on:
+  push:
+    branches:
+    - master
+  pull_request:
+    branches:
+    - master

+  pull_request:
+    branches:
+    - master

@@ -0,0 +1,53 @@
